bug.author: pgiammel
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
It's not possible to train a model with the newest (2.0.6) version of spacy. A token_vector_width KeyError is raised when calling begin_training on the language instance. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Install Spacy 2.0.6 Try the following:
import spacy model = spacy.load('en') opt = model.begin_training() <denchmark-h:h1>Environment</denchmark-h>
Using Spacy2.0.6 on two different environments:
Docker with base image python:3.6-slim Windows 7 x64 with a python3.6 x64 virtualenv
<denchmark-h:h1>Notes</denchmark-h>
The problem does not happen on 2.0.5

comments.comment: Thanks --- didn't have a test covering this...Training works if from scratch, but not if the model is pre-loaded as in your example. Fixing.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
